query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.description: "The first outcome of Task 3.5 ""Expanding the platform for (local) EPC cooperation"" is D3.5 API v1.0, able to transmit building data in a structured manner."

result.title: Report on adaptation requirements for countries - technical specification for the programming of the software tools, including templates for all rollout countries
result.description: "D3.3 will provide the technical specifications for the programming of the iBRoad2EPC software tools to be adapted to specific pilot country conditions. It will include definitions of country specific adaptations of parameters and building assessment as preparation for the software implementation. The report is the outcome of Task 3.3 ""Country adaptation"" and will include templates for all rollout countries."

result.title: How to best use financial and non-financial incentives for renovation in implementing markets
result.description: "As outcome of Task 5.4 ""Policy exploitation strategy"" D5.4 is an analysis to assess how EPCs are used to support deep renovation in implementing markets: review of financial and non-financial programmes for renovation (2-3 programmes per country) to assess if/how EPCs are used to trigger renovation, measure progress and achieve savings, their effectiveness in doing so and their alignment with national long-term renovation strategies. The analysis will assess if/how iBRoad2EPC approach is considered, opportunities for its adoption and recommendations on how to do so."

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: iBRoad2EPC training toolkit
result.description: "Under Task 4.2 ""Training of auditors (incl. EPC)"" / Subtask 4.2.1 ""Development of training material"", and based on the iBRoad training toolkit and a review of specific training requirements in each of the 6 implementing countries, an enhanced training toolkit will be developed which will include new features and factors, such as the Smart Readiness Indicator and the Indoor Environmental Quality of the buildings and covering more complex building typologies, e.g. multifamily and public buildings. The training toolkit will be organised in a semi-flexible way with general core information explaining principles and basic procedures, and country specific adaptations. The enhanced training toolkit will indicatively include the following parts: • Handbook for energy auditors • Presentations for the auditors´ training• Supporting material"

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Annotated agenda, background documents and proceeding (WP2)
result.description: Annotated agenda, background documents and proceedingincluding report/minutes (updated after each meeting (Kick-off-meeting and regional working sessions/digital meetings)).In the run-up to the roundtables, the results of the roundtables held beforehand are made available to the stakeholders, e.g. in the form of background papers/ working papers in the internal area on the project website, and the further course of the discussion is moderated in advance. In a federal republic like Germany with a lot of local differences, it is important to include the regional perspective of energy-efficient renovation following the kick-off roundtable meeting. Therefore, this task will focus on the regional specifics regarding the four clusters (financing opportunities, building types, specific legislation and possible distinctions regarding communication and decision-making process). This regional perspective will cover the following three regions in Germany: (a) North Rhine-Westphalia; (b) Baden-Württemberg and (c) Berlin/Brandenburg. (M08, updated M12, M15, M24, language: German, English summary)

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Plan created
result.description: The task of stakeholder management is to consider and integrate the interests of the various stakeholders appropriately. This includes the identification of all relevant stakeholders and the analysis of their respective interests (Stakeholder analysis and engagement plan. On this basis, communication activities and a Communication and Dissemination Plan, including a List of Conferences and Networks, are to be developed implemented and continuously reconsidered. If necessary, the communication measures will be adapted according to changing circumstances. (M05, language: German, English summary)

result.description: A project website will be implemented (M03, language: German, English). This will make sure that the developed financing instruments and the created supportive documents will be asked for by property managers and homeowners (the primary target group) and will help setting up pilot projects subsequent to GREEN Home. result.title: Recommendations for action to improve the legal framework
result.description: Policy documents and recommendations will condense the research and will point out how energy efficiency investments in HOAs can be further supported by political framework conditions. Recommendations refer to the current framework conditions on both regional and federal level and their effects on the HOAs’ readiness or willingness to invest. VDIV and DENEFF will address the respective stakeholders on the political level in order to appropriately distribute these policy documents (M25, language: German, Emglish summary).

result.title: "Documentation of national „Personas"""
result.description: So-called personas (target group description) will be designed in preparation for benchmarking best practices in work package 4. These personas will be specified in task 2.2.3. and verified in the first roundtable in WP3 on the decision-making level (task 3.2). A persona stands as a prototype for a group of users, with concrete characteristics and a specific usage behaviour. (M10, update M21; language: German, English summary)

result.title: THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN SOCIO-DEMOGRAPHIC VARIABLES AND JOB SATISFACTION: THE CASE OF THE REPUBLIC OF CROATIA

details.authors: Rade, Rajka; Đorđević, Biljana; Milanović, Sandra

project.title: UP-SKILLING RESEARCHERS FOR SUSTAINABLE ENTREPRENEURSHIP BASED ON INNOVATION PROCESS MANAGEMENT

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
